title: german_shepherd
body:
The German Shepherd, also known in Britain as an Alsatian, is a German breed of working [[dog]] of medium to large size. The breed was developed by Max von Stephanitz using various traditional German herding dogs from 1899.
 The ears are rather large and stand erect. The back is level and muscular, and the tail is bushy and curves downward. The coat is thick and rough and may be black, tan, black and tan or gray. The coat should be harsh and of medium length; however, long-coated individuals occur often.

The breed is commonly used by [[military]], [[police]] and emergency services for [[K9 (dog)|]].
other_names: ジャーマンシェパード

title: hero_(dq11)
body:
The protagonist of [i][[Dragon Quest XI]][/i]. A young man who is known to be the Luminary, a legendary hero who can save the world. He is imprisoned and accused of being the harbinger of evil, prompting his quest.

For the sake of convenience, his default name is [b]"Eleven"[/b]. He can also be refered to as [b]the Luminary[/b].

[spoiler]By the end, he's given the title of Roto/Erdrick, the implication being that his game is a distant prequel to [i][[Dragon Quest III]][/i], although how distant (or if there is any connection at all) is debatable.[/spoiler]

Him, along with the heroes of [i][[roto (dq3)|III]][/i], [i][[hero_(dq4)|IV]][/i], and [i][[hero_(dq8)|VIII]][/i], were chosen to be fighters on [[super_smash_bros.|Super Smash Bros. Ultimate]]'s first fighters pass. They are collectively Fighter #72, with Eleven as the "face".

title: jiangshi
body:
A Chinese [[undead]]. Often called a "Chinese hopping [[vampire]]".

They drain people's life energy, hence the "vampire" denomination, although they are more similar in concept to Western [[zombie|zombies]].  

They usually have fulu or [[ofuda]] (strips of paper) stuck to their foreheads. Modern iterations are often seen wearing a rimmed round hat known as a [[qingdai guanmao]], referencing how Chinese officials under the Qing Empire were viewed as bloodthirsty creatures with little regard for humanity.

Some common depictions are [[Qiqi (genshin impact)|]], [[Bongun]], [[Munak]], [[Hsien-ko]] and [[Miyako Yoshika]].

h4. See also

* [[undead]]
* [[Tag Group:Legendary Creatures]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Jiangshi":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jiangshi

title: tengen_toppa_gurren_lagann
body:
A 2007 original [[super robot]] [[mecha]] anime series animated by [[Gainax]] and co-produced by [[Aniplex]] and [[Konami]]. Best known for its over-the-top plot, action sequence, along with its ridiculously huge mecha.

h4. Plot summary

In the distant future, people build their homes and raise domestic animals in subterranean caverns. As a result, they live in fear of the occasional earthquake and cave-in, and have been for hundreds of years. Jeeha is one such village.

One day, a boy named [[Simon (ttgl)|]] happens to find a small, shiny drill while digging to expand the village. At the same time, [[Kamina (ttgl)|]], a guy who believes that there is another land above the village, persuades a gangster to break through the ceiling in order to leave the cavern. Suddenly, an earthquake occurs and the ceiling collapses, followed by a big [[robot]] breaking through the ceiling.

Kamina is now sure that there is a world above them. Recklessly, he begins to fight against the robot. At that moment, another person appears from the land above. It is a girl by the name of [[Yoko Littner|Yoko]]. With a [[rifle]] in hand, she had been tracking the robot. However, all she could do was distract it. Then, Simon shows what he had found to Kamina and Yoko. It's a mysterious robot whose head is also its body.

h4. Main Characters

title: alex_ross
body:
American painter and veteran expert artist notable for his very [[realistic]] depictions of [[comic]] and anime characters using only [[traditional media]] techniques. He uses mostly [[painting_(medium)|painting]]s.

title: world's_edge
body:
An [[in-universe location]] from [[Apex Legends]]. World's Edge is the second map, added to the game in Season 3. It is located on the planet Talos, and is near the village where [[Bloodhound (apex legends)|]] grew up. It is also the location where [[Revenant (apex legends)|]] killed Forge before joining the games himself.

There are Town Takeovers based on [[Bloodhound (apex legends)|]]  and [[Rampart (apex legends)|]] on the map, and it was temporarily home to the [[Mirage (apex legends)|]] Voyage.

title: settsuno_kirimaru
body:
A character in [[Rakudai Ninja Rantarou]].

Kirimaru is a 1st year student from the Ha-class in Ninjutsu Academy and one of a main protagonist in Nintama Rantarou. He is an orphan who lost his family and home during a war. He lives with [[Doi Hansuke|Doi-sensei]] when school isn't in session.

He usually wears dark blue scarf on both in his uniform and casual. In his casual, he has red orange sleeves with yellow at the top and dark blue pants.

Voiced by [[Tanaka Mayumi]].

title: nishinoya_yuu
body:
Nishinoya Yū is a character from [[Haikyuu!!]]
He is a second-year student at Karasuno High School. He serves as the libero for the school's [[volleyball]] team and is referred to by his teammates as "Karasuno's Guardian Deity" for his remarkable skills.

Nishinoya is the shortest member of the team, standing at 159.3 cm. He regularly styles his wild [[black hair]] by ruffling most of it upwards. He has [[blonde hair|blonde]] [[colored bangs]] and his eyes are [[brown eyes|brown]] and slanted.

Voiced by [[Okamoto Nobuhiko]].

title: science
body:
Any branch of study related to factual truths and principles. Likewise, it can be used to discover any facts that have not been uncovered yet using current systematic methods such as hypothesizing, observing, experimenting, measuring, and formulating laws to describe these facts.

There are numerous branches of science, and countless tools used to discover and/or prove these facts. Different scientific branches include [[math]]ematics, [[chemistry]], [[astronomy]], biology, engineering, medicine, social sciences, and physics, to name a few.

Only apply this tag if specific scientific knowledge or fact were referenced, as well as when the post is explaining certain scientifically process/theory.

title: berga_giros
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in the [[Gundam F91]] anime film from 1991.

[b]XM-05 Berga Giros[/b]

A high-end [[mobile_suit|MS]] developed by the [[Crossbone Vanguard]]. Intended to be used by commanders, the Berga Giros was slightly reduced in size compared to its predecessor units but made up for it with more shelf nozzles for added mobility and a beefed up reactor capable of generating more power than even the SNRI's fearsome [[f91_gundam|Gundam F91]]. 

It was chiefly piloted by the Black Vanguard's captain, [[Zabine Chareux]], who had his painted in the traditional black and lilac and sported a couple radio antennae and a custom [[Shot Lancer]] with extra machine guns on it.

title: hololive_english
body:
[[hololive]]'s English-language branch, launched in August 2020.

h4. List of Members

h5. hololive English -Myth- ([i]a.k.a.[/i] [[holoMyth]])
Debuted in September 2020.
* [[Ninomae Ina'nis]] "Ina"
* [[Takanashi Kiara]]
* [[Watson Amelia]] "Ame" (inactive since October 2024)
* [[Mori Calliope]] "Calli"
* [[Gawr Gura]] (graduated May 2025)

h5. hololive English -Promise- ([i]a.k.a.[/i] [[holoPromise]] [i]or[/i] CouncilRyS)
Officially merged as "Promise" in August 2023, but had already been a well-known unofficial group under the "CouncilRyS" name ever since Sana's graduation.
h6. Project: HOPE Vsinger
Debuted in July 2021.
* [[IRyS (hololive)|]]

h6. hololive English -Council- ([i]a.k.a.[/i] [[holoCouncil]])

* [[Nanashi Mumei]] (graduated April 2025)

h5. hololive English -Advent- ([i]a.k.a.[/i] [[holoAdvent]])
Debuted in July 2023.

* [[Koseki Bijou]] "Biboo"
* [[Nerissa Ravencroft]] "Rissa"

h5. hololive English -Justice- ([i]a.k.a.[/i] [[holoJustice]])
Debuted in June 2024.
* [[Elizabeth Rose Bloodflame]] "Liz"/"ERB"
* [[Gigi Murin]] "GG"
* [[Raora Panthera]]
* [[Cecilia Immergreen]] "Ceci"/"CC"

h5. Other

* [[Tsukumo San]], [[Ceres Faun]], [[Ouro Krono]], [[Nanashi Muman]], and [[Hayko]] - [[Genderswap]]ped versions of Council that appeared in a stream on January 25th, 2022.

h6. Unofficial

[[Akai Haato]] is sometimes jokingly referred to as "hololive English Gen 0", due to being the most capable English speaker in hololive's original Japanese branch (after [[Kiryu Coco]], who retired in July 2021). This is exacerbated by her frequent collaboration streams with hololiveEN members, and her insistent use of the hashtag "hololiveEN" in the titles and descriptions of her videos even when she's not collaborating.

h6. Staff
* [[Omega Alpha]] - an avatar of the holoEN's staff team with unique design
* [[Enma-chan]] - the [[real life insert|real life]] manager of Ina. Received a character design created by Ina.
* [[Kumomane]] - another manager of Ina. Tweeted on her behalf during a hiatus in October 2024.
* [[Jenma-chan]] - the real life manager of Gura, Amelia, and Kiara. Received a character design created by Kiara.
* [[J-chad]] - the real life manager of Calliope. Received a character design created by Calliope.

h6.  Mascots
See [[List of hololive mascots]]

title: ou-sama_no_propose
body:
[[Kuozaki Saika]]. The witch who continued to save the world facing apocalyptic events once in 300 hours, and the head of an academy that magicians attend.

"--- To you, I entrust this world---"

And -- the first love girl, who passed on her body and power to [[Kuga Mushiki]] and died. In order to not get exposed by anybody as Saika, Mushiki was instructed by Saika's servant [[Karasuma Kuroe]] to attend the academy, but... Feared by classmates and even teachers, he was receiving a turbulent lifestyle where he received advice on how liking the older brother comes from a reunited younger sister.

"Be quiet. Your arm will go out of control. -- Rather, your mouth will, should I say"

Furthermore, if he's careless, in order to return to being a male, a kiss from a female is absolutely necessary!?

The duo of "DATE A LIVE" will spark this new generation strongest first love!

title: vei_(vtuber)
body:
Polish-British [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]]. Previously an [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]] heavily associated with [[VShojo]], she formally joined the group on April 9, 2021, until leaving to return being an indie on April 26, 2023. Originally streamed with [[3D]] models by [[jjinomu]], switched to also using a [[Live2D]] model with her fourth costume after joining VShojo. She is the (non-IRL) significant other to [[Silvervale]], having married to each other in [[Final Fantasy XIV]] in February 2021.

She spends a lavish portion of her income to commission lewd arts of herself and her friends, resulting in a great number of posts on the site.

The 7th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[Vei (vtuber)|Veibae]], referred to as 'Sky Empress', which debuted on April 10, 2022. It's designed by [[Dishwasher1910]], and illustrated by [[Neonbeat]].

Having now become a [[dragon girl]], she gains [[dragon horns]], a [[blue fire|blue]] [[flame-tipped tail|flame-tipped]] [[dragon tail]], [[white hair]] and [[multicolored eyes|multicolored]] [[purple eyes|purple]]-[[yellow eyes]]. She wears a [[white leotard]], [[stirrup legwear|stirrup]] [[white thighhighs]], and a [[white robe|white]] [[fur-trimmed robe]], with options to enable or disable her wearing it.

title: holding_spice_shaker
body: [[Holding]] one of the many types of spice/topping shakers, such as [[salt shaker]] and [[pepper shaker]]s.  Examples of other types include cheese shakers, such as for shredded Parmesan cheese; powdered sugar shakers; and chili pepper shakers, such as for red pepper flakes or shichimi (七味唐辛子, seven-flavor chili pepper).

title: wcdonald's
body:
A common [[brand name imitation]] for the [[McDonald's]] fast food chain, commonly found in various Japanese media. It is typically done by turning the yellow M logo of McDonald's upside down to create a W, hence the name.

It eventually became an official brand co-opted by McDonald's themselves for an anime-themed international advertising campaign in Spring 2024.

title: the_cleveland_show
body:
The Cleveland Show is an American adult animated sitcom created by Seth MacFarlane, Richard Appel, and Mike Henry for the Fox Broadcasting Company. A spin-off of [[Family Guy]], and the second television series in the franchise, the series centers on [[Cleveland Brown]], his new wife [[Donna Tubbs|Donna Tubbs-Brown]], and their children Cleveland Brown Jr., [[Roberta Tubbs]], and Rallo Tubbs. The animation was produced by Fox Television Animation.

The show ran for four seasons from 2009 to 2013.

title: bartholomew_kuma
body:
[[One Piece]] character. One of the [[Shichibukai]]. A high-powered [[cyborg]] as a result of [[Dr. Vegapunk]]'s experiments, the [[Pacifista]], a high-powered combat androids, are modeled after him. He is considered a "walking mystery", with his true motivations unknown.

Having consumed the Nikyu Nikyu no Mi [[Devil Fruit]], he has paw pads on his hands with the power to deflect or contain anything, which he uses in various creative ways.

[spoiler]He was formerly a commander in the Revolutionary Army and [[Jewelry Bonney]]'s adoptive father. Kuma surrendered himself to the World Government in an attempt to find a cure for Bonney's disease. In doing so, Kuma voluntarily allowed himself to be modified into a cyborg and being erased of all emotions, despite objection from Vegapunk. His memories would be later secretly allocated into his programming by Vegapunk in hope that Bonney will be capable of bringing him back to who he once was.[/spoiler]
other_names: バーソロミュー・くま

title: gear_fifth
body:
A special power-up form of the character [[Monkey D. Luffy]] from [[One Piece]]. [spoilers]Technically the awakening of his devil fruit.[/spoilers] In this form, Luffy's hair and clothing turns white, his hair is now more "cloudy" in shape, and he gains a cloud ring around his head.

[Spoilers]Hito Hito No Mi, Model: Nika is a mythical zoan devil fruit which is currently possessed by Monkey D. Luffy. It enables the user to use the powers of [[Sun God Nika (one piece)|]] and it gives the user a rubber-like body. It was intentionally mislabeled as the "Gomu Gomu no Mi" by the World Government in an attempt to hide its true nature.

Its powers are limited only by its user's imagination. It can make everything they touch become rubbery or very elastic. It can also produce any element like lighting, fire, or ice if the user wants to. It can also make the user bigger or smaller at will. Effectively the user can fight as if they have "cartoon physics" not dissimilar to the ones found in American slapstick cartoons.[/spoilers]

title: metal_sonic_3.0
body:
An advanced robotic version of [[Metal Sonic]] from the [[Sonic (series)|Sonic the Hedgehog series]]. Metal Sonic 3.0 was built by [[Eggman Nega]], rather than by [[Dr. Eggman]] himself. In essence, he’s a more modern, reprogrammed upgrade meant to complement—and in some respects, rival—the original Metal Sonic.

While he shares a similar body model with the original Metal Sonic, Metal Sonic 3.0 is distinguished by his different color scheme: predominantly black with yellow accents (as opposed to the classic blue of his predecessor). This difference not only sets him apart aesthetically but also ties him to Eggman Nega’s personal style.

h4. See also
* [[Mecha Sonic MkI]]
* [[Mecha Sonic MkI (8-bit)]]
* [[Mecha Sonic MkII]]

title: rebuild_of_evangelion
body:
A retelling of the original [[super robot]] [[neon_genesis_evangelion|anime series]] that aired in the mid 90's. 

It features new footage, animation, 3D cg, and a new female character named [[Makinami Mari Illustrious]]. It also changes [[Souryuu Asuka Langley]]'s name to Shikinami Asuka Langley.

[[Anno Hideaki]] served as the writer and general manager of the project, with Tsurumaki Kazuya, Masayuki, Maeda Mahiro and Nakayama Katsuichi directing the films themselves. [[Sadamoto Yoshiyuki]], [[Yamashita Ikuto]] and Sagisu Shirō returned to provide character designs, [[mecha]]nical designs and music respectively.

title: para_(vtuber)
body:
French [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]] [[virtual youtuber]] who streams in English. Known for her love of meat despite being a bunny. 
Streaming avatar for [[wwparasi]].

She debuted on February 8th, 2023.

A [[rabbit girl]] with [[very long hair|very long]] [[light blue hair]], an [[ahoge]], and [[lop rabbit ears]] which are covered in [[blood stain|blood stained]] [[bandages]]. Her eyes are [[red eyes|red]] with [[@ @|swirls]], and she has [[hikimayu]] styled eyebrows.

Occasionally depicted as [[gyaru]] with [[tan|tanned skin]] and [[blonde hair]]. Frequently depicted as [[beer|alcoholic]]

title: mermaid_man
body: Ernie (or Jim) Huckler, commonly known by his superhero name Mermaid Man, is a semi-retired superhero who lives in Bikini Bottom. He and his sidekick Barnacle Boy are the stars of a show-within-a-show called The Adventures of Mermaid Man and Barnacle Boy, but they are also real superheroes within the [[SpongeBob SquarePants]] universe.

title: neun_02
body: Also known as D-029, she is a gigantic wall of flesh spanning 109 yards created by [[Oliver Lobelia]]. She conceives about 33,000 to 34,000 creatures in her body. Oliver hopes to use her as as a weapon to destroy the Royal Capital. However, it turns out she doesn't want to destroy anything and is actually sapient. She befriends [[ebel alfie|Ebel]], [[enri louvre|Enri]] and [[emma white|Emma]] and allies with them to stop the Lobelia Corporation.

title: amalia_lobelia
body: Supporting character and protagonist of [[Naraku X]]. Amalia is a classmate of [[ebel alfie|Ebel]], whom she has an obsessive crush on. Is working as a spy and is a member of House Lobelia.

title: gladion_(pokemon)
body: [[Pokemon|Pokémon]] character, introducted in [[pokemon sm|Sun and Moon]]. Known as "Gladio" in Japan. He has [[green eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] with an [[ahoge]] and [[hair over one eye|bangs over one eye]]. His signature Pokémon is [[Silvally]]. His usual attire includes [[ear piercing]]s, a [[torn shirt|torn]] [[black shirt]] under a [[grey vest|grey]] [[hooded vest]] with [[tassel]]s, and [[torn pants|torn]] [[black pants]]. He also wears [[red shoes]] , and a [[red bag|red]] [[fanny pack]] around his waist. h4. Official art * !post #5456955: [[pokemon sm|Sun/Moon]] * !post #3233290: [[pokemon sm|Sun & Moon Anime]] h4. Trivia * He works alongside [[Team Skull]] in the games and the Pokemon Adventures manga, but not in the anime. * Gladion's family includes [[Lillie (pokemon)|]], who's his sister, as well as [[Lusamine (pokemon)|]] and [[Mohn (pokemon)|]], who's his mother and father respectively. * Gladion doesn't say much, but he cares deeply about his friends, family, and Pokémon. title: gohei
body:
[i]Gohei[/i] (御幣), aka [i]onbe[/i] (御幣) or [i]heisoku[/i] (幣束). 

A wooden wand traditionally decorated with [[shide]] (zigzag paper streamers), though in the past it was made with rectangular strips of paper. It is used for [[Shinto]] rituals to cleanse negative energy or bless.

Notable characters with gohei include [[Hakurei Reimu]], [[Kochiya Sanae]] (who is often seen using an old-fashioned gohei with a single rectangular strip of paper on the end) and [[Yae Miko]] (who uses the more modern, zigzag paper strip gohei).

title: kaiten_(weapon)
body:
The "Kaiten" (回天, literally "heaven shaker"), was a large manned suicide [[torpedo]] based of the infamous Type 93 "Long Lance" employed by the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] for suicide attacks. It is similar to [[kamikaze pilot]]s, as both were conceptualized during the late stage of [[World War II]] in a desperate attempt to slow down Allied force's advance to the Japanese home island.

It was of questionable use and exceptionally dangerous to both those handling them and the pilots; around 200 kaiten trainees, mechanics and hosts (the kaiten were fired from other ships or submarines) were killed while attempting to employ kaitens. Meanwhile, only 3 ships were sunk by the weapon.

title: chain_chomp
body:
A recurring enemy from the [[mario_(series)|Mario series]].

Their basic appearance is of an animate, carnivorous [[ball and chain (weapon)|]]:  a black circle or sphere with a large, [[sharp teeth|toothy]] mouth, beady eyes, and a metal [[chain]] attached opposite the mouth. The other end of the chain is typically fixed to a sturdy, immobile object.

They behave like guard dogs, lunging at any enemy in range:  their Japanese name, "Wan-wan," is an onomatopoeia for the sound a dog makes, analogous to "Woof-woof" or "Bark-bark".

They occasionally make cameo appearances in other [[Nintendo]] games.  In particular, [i][[The Legend of Zelda: Link's Awakening]][/i] features a friendly, domesticated Chain Chomp named [[bow wow (zelda)|BowWow]] which will attack Link's enemies.

h4. Official art

body:
Bloopers (often referred to as Bloobers until [[Paper Mario]], though Blooper was in use beforehand) are squid-like creatures that are found in the [[Mario (series)|Mario series]]. They made their first appearance in [[Super Mario Bros. 1]], and various kinds of them have appeared in most Mario games since, normally as enemies.

Their Japanese name is ゲッソー (Gessoo) which is a pun on げそ (geso; squid legs) and officially romanized as "Gesso".

body:
One of the many [[toad (mario)|Toads]] in the [[Mario_(series)|Mario]] franchise.

First appearing in [i][[Super Mario Galaxy]][/i], Captain Toad is a [[Red Toad (mario)|Red Toad]] who leads the adventurous Toad Brigade, who seeks to help out his kingdom whenever available. A bit of a coward. 

Later got his own spinoff game, [i][[Captain Toad: Treasure Tracker]][/i]. Because of his heavy backpack, he is unable to jump.

Do not confuse him for the Toad typically used as Mario and co.'s companion.

title: the_kiss
body:
An oil painting by Austrian painter Gustav Klimt, circa 1907/1908. It depicts a [[couple]] clad in [[yellow theme|predominantly yellow]], with a man [[kiss|kissing]] a [[kneeling]] woman on the cheek as her [[head tilt|head is tilted]] to the side. 

The painting has been featured in several [[fine art parody|fine art parodies]], including as the focal point of [[Elfen Lied]]'s opening.

h4. Reference
* !asset #24469272 

h4. See also
[[Tag group:fine art parody]]

title: the_scream
body:
"A famous 1893 painting":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Scream] by [[Edvard Munch]].

Munch recalled that he had been out for a walk at sunset when suddenly the setting sun's light turned the clouds "a blood red". He sensed an "infinite scream passing through nature". Scholars agree it was the immense eruption of the [[volcano]] Mount Krakatoa, which could be heard 5,000km away and colored skies across the world that prompted the reaction.

The agonized face in the painting has become one of the most iconic images of art, seen as symbolizing the anxiety of the human condition. Munch's work, including The Scream, would go on to have a formative influence on the Expressionist movement. And the subject of many [[fine art parody|fine art parodies]].

title: outside_of_play_area
body:
When users of [[PlayStation VR]]s tilt their angle at a compromising position or go beyond play range (more commonly on the former), the user is greeted with a black screen (or black superimposition) and the message "Outside of Play Area" (プレイエリアの外です—Play Area [i]no soto desu[/i]).

Often used as an [[interface censor]], even for [[pantyshot]]s, to enforce modesty. The latter is a prominent case usage of the censorship, already seen in PSVR games.

There is currently no workaround for this kind of censorship.
other_names: プレイエリアの外です

title: oak_casket_(path_to_nowhere)
body:
A playable character from [[Path to Nowhere]]. Voiced by [[Oonishi Saori]].

An S rank Sinner, Oak Casket is the Undertaker at the bottom level of the Drifter Camp, a Sinner with a very high affinity with death. Her alignment is Sloth.

Oak Casket has (slightly [[curly hair|curly]]/[[wavy hair|wavy]]) [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] with black [[streaked hair|streaks]], her skin is [[pale skin|pale]], she has [[heterochromia]] eyes ([[purple eyes|purple]] left, [[green eyes|green]] right), usually seen with [[purple eyeshadow]] and [[purple lips]] make-ups.

She wears a [[black robe]]/[[black dress]] with a large [[center opening]], exposing her [[large breasts]], [[stomach]] and [[navel]], the outfit itself has [[hobble dress|hobble dress skirt]]. Other clothing elements include a [[white shawl]], a pair of [[black gloves]], and a pair of [[black footwear|black]] [[ankle boots]]. Usually seen with two [[handgun]]s.

title: sith
body:
[quote][i]Peace is a lie. There is only Passion.
Through Passion I gain Strength.
Through Strength I gain Power.
Through Power I gain Victory.
Through Victory my chains are Broken.
The Force shall free me.[/i] - The Code of the Sith.[/quote]

A fictional [[darksider_(star_wars)|darksider]] group from the [[Star Wars]] universe.

An evil and brutal order of merciless, treacherous (even among themselves), chaotic and power-hungry murdering warriors and conquerors, the [b]Sith[/b] despise weaker lifeforms and seek only total control of the galaxy and the Force with the complete and utterly destruction of their adversaries, most notably the [[Jedi]].

Their main weapon is the [[lightsaber]], which usually has a [[red lightsaber|red colored laser blade]].

h4. Known Sith

* [[Darth Vader]]
* [[Palpatine]]
* [[Darth Maul]]
* [[Count Dooku]]

title: gundam_cross_war
body:
[b]Gundam Cross War[/b] is a collectible card game based on the [[Gundam]] franchise. 

It launched throughout Southeast Asia in October, 2015 and was available for purchase in [[Japan]], [[Macau]], [[Taiwan]], [[Thailand]], [[Singapore]], [[Indonesia]], [[Malaysia]], [[Australia]] and the [[Philippines]]. 

However, in adition to being a standard tabletop competitive card game, players could also scan the 2-D barcodes on the back of their physical cards using the Gundam Cross War app to register their cards to their [[Bandai]]-Namco account to play online.

On July 7th, 2017 it was announced that Cross War would be ending service following the release of the final booster that October. The servers for the app shut down on December 31, 2017, but card errata and official in-store tournament support were still continued into March of 2018.

body:
A fictional manned giant combat robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in [[Crossbone Gundam]].

[b]XM-X3 (F97) Crossbone Gundam X-3[/b]

A prototype Gundam type [[mobile suit]] developed for the [[Crossbone Vanguard]]. 

While very similar in appearance to its brother units [[crossbone Gundam x-1|X-1]] and [[crossbone Gundam x-2|X-2]], the third Crossbone Gundam carried two powerful I-Field Generators in its shoulders, enhancing protection even further, which enabled pilot [[Tobia Arronax]] to fight extremely aggressively while remaining unharmed.

title: tankette
body:
A type of tracked armoured [[military vehicle|fighting vehicle]]. Essentially a miniature [[tank]], tankettes are small, lightly armed and armored vehicle typically armed with [[machine gun]]s or a small-calibre [[cannon]]. Its primary function was to perform reconnaissance and anti-infantry roles.

Tankettes are prominently used during the interwar and [[World War II]] period before being replaced with infantry fighting vehicle (IFV).

title: slime_(creature)
body:
A common enemy in many RPGs. Usually represented as a blob, possibly with eyes. Sometimes, it is depicted with a [[core]], which functions similarly to the brain/heart.

It usually has the ability to melt and digest its victim's body. Because of this, it became a popular monster in JRPGs and fantasy stories, especially the [[Dragon Quest]] series.

Similar to [[tentacles]], slimes are common monsters in NSFW works, partly due to its corrosive properties being used to melt the clothes instead, and partly as a measure to avoid censorship.

For slime as a substance or with tentacles, see [[slime (substance)]].

h4. Examples

* !post #7085369

h4. See also

* [[slime girl]]
* [[slime boy]]
* [[slime (substance)]]
* [[slime sex]]

title: tentacles
body:
A tentacle is an elongated flexible organ present in animals, especially invertebrates such as [[octopus]]es. Usually, tentacles are used for feeding, feeling and grasping. In manga and anime, [[plant]]s may have tentacles as well, in the form of movable [[vines]]. And, naturally, other animals and monsters are depicted with tentacles.

Tentacles are most prominently featured in numerous Japanese NSFW works, originally as a measure to avoid having to censor a [[penis]]. In these works, tentacles are depicted as a type of fleshy [[monster]] whose body is almost entirely composed of tentacles, and they use these appendages to [[tentacle sex|the victim]] to extract the "nutrients".

title: globus_cruciger
body:
The [b]Globus Cruciger[/b] (Lit. "Cross-bearing orb") is a heraldry symbol used for centuries as a symbol of Christ's dominion over the Earth and, by conscious extension, the divine right of kings. It appeared as an [[orb]] topped with a [[cross]].

 The best-known globus cruciger today is probably the English "Sovereign's Orb":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crown_Jewels_of_the_United_Kingdom#Orbs], one of the signature pieces of the crown jewels of Britain, which was parodied by [[Monty Python]] as the "[[Holy Hand Grenade]] of Antioch".

The [[Kantai Collection]] incarnation of the British battleship HMS [[Warspite (kancolle)|]] carries a black iron globus cruciger as part of her rigging (with the cross in the form of a sword with a radar antenna attached to the pommel), presumably as a reference to the crown jewels (much as her mast is designed to resemble the Sovereign's Sceptre with Cross).

The fashion brand [[Vivienne Westwood]] uses the globus cruciger as its logo and is featured in many of its designs.

h4. Example

Alternatively, it can also refer to the explosive weapon in [[Worms_(game)|]], itself a reference to the above and is essentially a more powerful version of the grenade with a fixed fuse (3 seconds or until rest), a wider AOE and a chanted "Hallelujah!" before explosion.

title: worms_(game)
body:
Worms is a turn-based, artillery, strategy and puzzling game series. The goal of each game is to eliminate all Worms in each enemy's team. This goal can be achieved by using weapons to reduce the enemy Worms' energy to zero, or drown them. The match can also be won if the other team Surrenders. Each team has weapons to defeat the enemy team. The game contains normal weapons like the Bazooka, Shotgun and the Uzi, but also unusual and bizarre weapons like the Concrete Donkey, Super Sheep, Banana Bomb, etc. Utilities can also be found in game, such as the Ninja Rope, a flexible rope with more options than expected for moving Worms, the Jet Pack, and the Teleport. The players will just get a specific amount of weapons, while other weapons, utilities and additional health can be found in Crates which drop from the sky.

The game series also contains less common Schemes like Rope Racing, where the players should get from the start to the finish as fast as possible while only using the Ninja Rope. Players will use the Worm-like acrobats or Tarzan, who swings from rope-to-rope.

The series also has a few characters, such as Boggy B, Spadge, and Clagnut. There are also villains like Professor Worminkle and Boggy the Kid. However, the series' characters are almost entirely left out, since Worms focuses mostly on the missions and combat. 

https://worms.fandom.com/wiki/Worms_(series)

title: x2_(2003)
body: X2 (also marketed as X2: X-Men United, and internationally as X-Men 2) is a 2003 American superhero film directed by Bryan Singer. The film is based on the [[X-Men]] superhero team appearing in [[Marvel]] Comics. It is the sequel to [[X-Men (2000)]], as well as the second installment in the [[X-Men film series]], and features an ensemble cast including [[Patrick Stewart]], [[Hugh Jackman]], [[Ian McKellen]], [[Halle Berry]], Famke Janssen, James Marsden, Rebecca and Anna Paquin. The plot, inspired by the graphic novel God Loves, Man Kills, concerns the genocidal Colonel William Stryker leading an assault on Professor Xavier's school to build his own version of Xavier's mutant-tracking computer, Cerebro, in order to destroy every mutant on Earth and to save the human race from them, forcing the X-Men to team up with the Brotherhood of Mutants to stop Stryker and save the mutant race.

title: voodoo_doll
body:
[b]Voodoo dolls[/b] are [[doll]]s that are used by Houngans ([[Voodoo]] [[priest]]s) in curse rituals. It is well known that by stabbing a doll with a [[pin]], the person who is the target of the curse is hurt in the same place as the doll.

Typically, voodoo dolls are made to resemble human figure using either rags or clay. Though in many cases, it is made [[character doll|in the likeness of the victim]].

In reality, this kind of curse didn't exist in the original Voodoo. It is thought that the practice was imagined by the writer of some movie or novel. These dolls can be obtained easily as a souvenir in [[Haiti]].

h4.See also

* [[doll]]
* [[straw doll]]

title: los_angeles_police_department
body:
The Los Angeles Police Department is one of the more well-known police forces in America. Due to serving one of its major cities, their storied history (especially issues with minority communities and their frequent conflicts with inner-city criminal gangs), and proximity to Hollywood, the LAPD has been featured extensively in American pop culture in both straightforward incarnation to satire, from [[Grand Theft Auto]] to [[The Terminator]] to The Closer.

The department is headed by a Chief and operates within the jurisdiction of the City of Los Angeles. Although not the first police department in the United States to have a [[S.W.A.T.]] (Special Weapons and Tactics) unit, the establishment of it in 1967 by John Nelson and expansion under the leadership of the controversial Daryl Gates would solidify the unit into public consciousness. 

The department tasked with upholding the law, traffic control, prevention and response to crime, and providing community services. The LAPD is organized into 39 divisions and 10 bureaus to address different aspects of law enforcement.

h4. See also
* [[Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department]]

h4. External Links
* "Official LAPD Website":[https://www.lapdonline.org/]

title: gyuudon
body:
A Japanese dish consisting of a [[bowl]] of [[rice]] topped with [[beef]] and onion simmered in a mildly sweet sauce flavored with dashi (fish and seaweed stock), soy sauce and mirin (sweet rice wine). It also often includes shirataki noodles, and is sometimes topped with a raw [[egg]]. A very popular food in Japan, it is commonly served with [[benishouga]] (pickled ginger), shichimi (ground chili pepper), and a side dish of miso soup. Gyuu means "cow" or "beef", and don is short for [[donburi]], the Japanese word for "bowl".

h4. See also

* Gyuudon restaurants
** [[Matsuya Foods]]
** [[Sukiya]]
** [[Yoshinoya (restaurant)]]

title: cross_ange_tr
body:
A game base on the anime Cross Ange. The game take place in an alternate continuity following main protagonist, Naomi, who was deceased in the anime.

Most of the pivotal events are identical to the anime, with certain changes in elements due to Naomi's appearances and expanded scenarios based on her choices throughout the game.

title: naomi_(cross_ange)
body:
Naomi is a deceased character in Cross Ange, and the main protagonist of the game Cross Ange tr. alternate continuity. Her full name is shown to be Naomi Eunice.

She is a new member of Arzenal's First Troop. During the anime continuity, she lost her life and her suit was handed down to Ange. In the game continuity, she fell into a coma before reawaken after a chance meeting with an unknown voice. She pilots the AW-CBR115 Glaive, salvaged and repaired from the parts of Coco, Miranda and Zola destroyed units.

Voiced by Sayuri Hara.

body:
Touhou Gishinreibyou (東方偽神霊廟) is a fan-made Touhou Project script for the Touhou Danmakufu shooting game engine, directed by NRT and developed by Yuuyu, Hatsuke, and ido, the same team behind The Last Comer. It consists of 3 stages (starting at stage 4) and an Extra stage, and is based on a false prediction for the full version of Ten Desires.

The game was released in full on 29 August 2012.

title: holocouncil
body:
[b]hololive English -Council-[/b], shortened as [b]holoCouncil[/b], is the second generation of [[hololive English]]. The lore of this generation is that each member is an avatar of a particular aspect of the universe: specifically Space, Earth/Nature, Time, Civilization, and Chaos.

Council originally consisted of [[Hakos Baelz]], [[Ouro Kronii]], [[Nanashi Mumei]], [[Ceres Fauna]], and [[Tsukumo Sana]], until the graduation of [[Tsukumo Sana]] on July 31, 2022.

Council frequently collabed with and became heavily associated with [[IRyS (hololive)|]], who debuted only one month prior. The five-plus-one members became known as an unofficial subunit dubbed CouncilRyS. Following the graduation of [[Tsukumo Sana]], the remaining CouncilRyS members were reorganized into an official unit named [[holoPromise]].

Use this tag when Bae, Kronii, Mumei, Fauna, and optionally Sana and IRyS (or their respective mascots) are deliberately grouped together. Use holoPromise when Bae, Kronii, Mumei, Fauna, and IRyS are grouped together.

h4. Examples

* !post #4723717

h4. Members

* [[Hakos Baelz]]
* [[Ouro Kronii]]

* [[Ceres Fauna]] (graduated on January 2025)

title: doctor_doom
body:
[i]"Ms. Van Dyne, I am not some common criminal that can be distracted by your prattling. You are nothing to Doom. And your pathetic attempts to play feeble mindgames with me amount to exactly[/i] less [i]than nothing. So please, stop embarrassing yourself."[/i]
--[b]Dr. Doom,[/b] [i]The Avengers: Earth's Mightiest Heroes[/i]

Doctor Victor Von Doom is a [[Marvel]] comics villain, ruler of Latveria, and arch-enemy of the [[Fantastic Four]]. Originally a boy from a Romani family, he witnessed his mother's death at the hands of some demons she had summoned to fight Latverian soldiers. Swearing revenge, he began to master magic and technology. Eventually, he traveled to America to study some more, and that is where he met (and eventually became foes with) [[Reed Richards]].

Due to an incident involving constructing a portal to Hell to resurrect his mother, Doom blamed Richards for the incident for causing the scars on his face. He constructed a suit of metal armor and became the cloaked tyrant scientist known today. He considers himself to be the smartest man on Earth and shows signs of politeness to his enemies. He's known for talking about himself in the third person and for having several "Doombots" that can pose as him.

Aside the Fantastic Four, Doom has faced nearly every superhero in the Marvel Universe: [[Avengers (series)|The Avengers]], [[Spider-Man]], and the [[X-Men]], to name a few.

Doom appears in various Marvel-related media, such as movies, TV shows, and video games. Among one of his most famous appearances is in the [[Marvel vs. Capcom]] series of fighting games, where he is a playable character. In Japan, his [[Fantastic Four (1967 TV series)|1967 animated version]], known as Akuma Hakase, or Dr. Demon, is fondly remembered by older fans for being a more comedic spin on the character, speaking in [[Nagoyaben]].

title: janggi
body: Janggi, sometimes called Korean chess, is a strategy board game popular on the Korean Peninsula. The game was derived from [[xiangqi]], and is very similar to it, including the starting position of some of the pieces, and the 9×10 gameboard, but without the xiangqi "river" dividing the board horizontally in the middle.

title: hulk
body: A [[Marvel]] superhero. A split personality of [[Bruce Banner]] created after exposure to gamma radiation. The Hulk emerges whenever Bruce is enraged, and he's usually an unstoppable force of destruction, although he's ocassionally shown to have kidness and a desire for peace deep down, and even some of Bruce's scientific knowledge.

title: bruce_banner
body: Bruce Banner, Ph.D. is a character from the [[Marvel]] universe, an American theoretical physicist, famed for his work in the fields of nuclear physics and gamma radiation. An accidental exposure to gamma radiation lead him to develop a superpowerful alternate personality called the [[Hulk]] which appears when he gets angry.

title: magik_(x-men)
body:
Real name Illyana Rasputina, an [[X-Men]] character and the younger sister of [[Colossus (X-men)|]]. A mutant with the power to open portals to other dimensions, she spent her childhood in a dimension known as Limbo, whose demonic ruler taught her everything about magic until she became a Sorcerer Supreme. She wields a sword that can cut through magic while leaving physical objects unharmed.

She appears in [[Marvel Rivals]]. She was portrayed by [[Anya Taylor-Joy]] in [[The New Mutants]].

body:
[[Marvel]] character with the appearance of a humanoid tree. Originally introduced in 1960 as a horror monster, he was reimagined in 2006 as a benevolent alien and made into a member of the [[Guardians of the Galaxy]].
He's known for being able to speak only one phrase: "I am Groot".

title: armlock
body:
The act of locking another persons arms above their head. In short terms, it is a move where you lock another persons arms in place. It looks a bit similar to a [[full nelson]], but unlike where a full nelson, you don't grab the neck when you perform an armlock. Do not confuse this with holding arms, which is simply put any the act of holding another person's arms.

For the grappling technique also called "armlock", see [[armbar]].

h4. See Also
* [[locked arms]]
* [[holding back]]

title: solomon_(fate)
body:
Antagonist from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Designated as the [[Grand Caster (Fate)|]]. Created modern magecraft, ushering in the Age of Man, earning the name "King of Magic" for his feat.

[spoiler]Was the Caster in the Grand/Order universe's version of the 2004 Fuyuki Holy Grail War, and his Master was [[Marisbury Animusphere]]. After winning the war and granted a chance to make a wish to the Holy Grail, the Master wished for enough funds to complete the creation of Chaldea. For the Servant, a chance to live life as a normal human being as [[Romani Archaman]]. Romani (the real Solomon) returned his gifts to God (and gave up his human life) at the climax of the first Grand Order to give the player a fighting chance to defeat [[Goetia (fate)|]] -- who had hijacked Solomon's body -- the real villain of the first Grand Order. His true appearance can be seen in post #9149017.[/spoiler]

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Sugita Tomokazu]] [spoiler]([[Goetia (fate)|]]), [[Suzumura Ken'ichi]] (true)[/spoiler]

title: defloration
body:
[i]Not to be confused with [[menstruation]][/i]

The tearing of a girl's [[hymen]], indicating she has lost her [[virgin|virginity]].

In hentai, this is typically indicated by [[blood]] coming from the [[pussy|vagina]] during or after [[sex]], implying that the hymen has been torn and the girl has lost her virginity. In real life, the hymen is not always torn by first sexual intercourse and thus is not a reliable indicator of virginity. It can also be torn through other ways besides sex.

Use [[blood from vagina]] instead if the blood comes from an injury such as vaginal tearing rather than loss of virginity.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Hymen":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hymen]

title: gelgoog_hmt_gald_kureiz_use
body:
A fictional manned giant battle robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It appears in [[Gundam Blazing Shadow]].

[b]MS-14B Gelgoog High Mobility Type [Gald Kureiz use][/b]

A customized repair of [[Gald Kureiz]]'s MS-14B [[Gelgoog]] High Mobility Type［Falaq] after it was damaged. 

The destroyed right arm has been replaced with an arm unit based on the MSM-07E [[Z'Gok-E]] to strengthen its power in melee combat, and a propulsion unit based on the MS-14BR Gelgoog High Mobility R Type has been equipped on the legs.

title: gundam_g-saviour
body:
A [[canada|Canadian]] produced, made-for-TV, live action [[science fiction]] movie in the [[Gundam]] franchise released in [[2000]]. It is the furthest entry in the UC timeline, taking place in [b]UC 0223[/b]. The film has received negative reception from many fans due to it's stiff acting, low production values, and basic plot that lacks many Gundam staples. 

Despite the film's poor reception, it still received a number of supplementary materials, including a sequel [[video game]], prequel audio drama, and novel adaptation. The novel notably features a more "Gundam" plot, including a colony drop scene that was not in the movie, and features official illustrations by [[Suzuki Masahisa]].

While [[Bandai]] is quite negligent of this entry, it is still considered part of the UC canon, and the titular mobile suit made a cameo appearance in [[Gundam Build Fighters|Build Fighters]].

title: marasai
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]] from 1985.

[b]RMS-108 Marasai[/b]

Originally developed by [[Anaheim Electronics]] as the MSA-002 [[mobile_suit|MS]] for the [[AEUG]], pressure by [[titans_(gundam)|the Titans]] meant the [[Zeon]]ic looking type was forced into service by the oppressive elite Federation unit in mostly orange colors during U.C. 0087. While it was a comprehensive all-round improvement over the pitiful [[Hizack]], its weapon selection was much more limited, as it could only load advanced beam weapons. Later replaced by the more capable [[Barzam]] in frontline service. 

After the [[zeta_gundam|Gryphs War]] the last surviving Marasai units were acquired by [[Neo Zeon]] who used them to fill their ranks with a gray color scheme several years later. Some optimized green and grey Marasais even ended up being used by [[full_frontal|"The Sleeves"]] during their [[gundam_unicorn|Attack on Torrington Base]].

title: black_rose_(sonic_prime)
body:
A character from the [[Sonic (series)|Sonic the Hedgehog series]], introduced in [i][[Sonic Prime]][/i]. She is a variant of [[Amy Rose]], hailing from the No Place dimension. Unlike the original Amy Rose, who is recognized for her cheerful demeanor and affection toward [[Sonic the Hedgehog|Sonic]], Black Rose embodies a swashbuckling pirate persona.

Black Rose shares Amy Rose's core physical traits as a pink-furred anthropomorphic hedgehog with light green eyes and peach skin. However, her pirate-inspired attire sets her apart. She wears a dark brown bandana, a vest, and other clothing that complements her seafaring lifestyle, giving her a distinct and rugged look suited to her role as a pirate captain.

title: shiono_nagisa
body:
Character in [[Kateikyoushi no Onee-san]].

Shiono Nagisa is a laid-back, carefree Math teacher who is hired by [[Sakura Touya]]'s father to tutor his son, alongside her colleages [[Akizuki Sara]], [[Amemiya Amane]], and [[Onodera Rio]]. She is particularly notorious in the OVA adaptation for [[wrestling]] Touya whenever he gets a question wrong.

She is a young, voluptuous woman with [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] and [[black eyes]], typically wearing a [[white camisole]] with black [[denim shorts]] and a black [[choker]].

title: chaos_sonic
body:
A character introduced in the animated series [[Sonic Prime]]. He is a [[robot]] created by [[Mr. Dr. Eggman]], the leader of the Chaos Council, designed to imitate and surpass [[Sonic the Hedgehog]]. Chaos Sonic's appearance mirrors Sonic's, featuring a dark blue, slender robotic body with elongated limbs, yellow accents, and red shoe-like feet. His head includes faux quills and ears, with a glowing cyan screen displaying his red "eyes."

title: cristiano_ronaldo
body:
[b]Cristiano Ronaldo dos Santos Aveiro[/b] (b. 5 February 1985) is a [[Portugal|Portuguese]] [[soccer|footballer]], renowned around the world as one of the best strikers of all time since his time at [[Manchester United]], helping his team win a Champions League title in 2008, and that season being honored as the [[FIFA]] World Player of the Year. He has also played for [[Real Madrid]], and [[Juventus FC]], and has received numerous awards and championship titles.

During the end of his career, he played at the Saudi club Al-Nassr (which is funded by Saudi crown prince Mohammed bin Salman). He would be added as a guest character in [[Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves]] (the developers, [[SNK]], is currently almost entirely owned by bin Salman's foundation).

He is frequently paired with fellow striker [[Lionel Messi]] due to their rivalry as the best player in the world during their prime.

title: t-34
body:
The [b]T-34[/b] was a [[Soviet]] medium [[tank]] that had a profound and lasting effect on the field of tank design as it spawned the concept of what is nowadays known as modern Main Battle Tanks or MBTs.

Although its armour and armament were surpassed later in the war, it has been often credited as the most effective, efficient, and influential tank design of [[World War II]] due to its multiple innovations. More than 80,000 T-34s and its variants were produced by the Soviet Union during WWII, making it the most produced tank of the whole war. Because of this some experts have even declared that the T-34 is "the tank that saved the Soviet Union".

At its introduction, the T-34 possessed an unprecedented combination of firepower, mobility, speed, protection, and ruggedness. Its 76.2 mm (3 in) high-velocity tank gun provided a substantial increase in firepower over any of its contemporaries; its heavy sloped armor was difficult to penetrate by most contemporary anti-tank weapons. Its engine was small and efficient, also providing very high speed and a long autonomy and range. However, this come at the cost of atrocious crew ergonomics as the crew of four (later five in the late [[T-34-85]] variant) were tightly packed in frontal compartment.

title: yasuke
body:
[b]Yasuke[/b] was the Japanese name given to a black slave who was brought by Jesuit priests to Japan, where he caught the interest of [[Oda Nobunaga]], who had never seen a black man before, and made Yasuke his retainer, making him the first known foreign born samurai. Yasuke served Nobunaga from 1581 until 1582 when Nobunaga died after being betrayed by one of his generals, [[Akechi Mitsuhide]]. Yasuke fought with Oda's loyalist forces against the Akechi rebels before being captured and sent back to the Jesuits where his fate after that remains unknown.

title: toyama_kasumi
body:
The [[electric_guitar|guitarist]] and vocalist of the band [[Poppin'Party]], and main protagonist of [[BanG Dream!]]. She is an energetic and optimistic girl who was inspired by a starlit night to begin playing music. 

She has [[brown hair]] with [[double bun|double]] [[cone hair bun]]s meant to resemble a star (how they work are a mystery, even to other characters), and [[purple eyes]].

She has a younger sister called [[Toyama Asuka]].

Her birthday is July 14th. Her seiyuu is [[Terakawa Aimi]].

h4. See also
* [[POPY (yumenokessho)|]] - a [[Yumenokessho]]/[[CeVIO]]/[[Synthesizer V]] voicebank based on her

title: gudaguda_meiji_ishin
body:
[b]GUDAGUDA Meiji Restoration[/b]
[quote]GUDAGUDA IS BACK!
A trail of GUDAGUDA Particles has led you to late Edo-period Kyoto, where the winds of change are blowing.
A mysterious army of Mini Nobus has overrun the city, and the storm of GUDAGUDA Restoration rages!

Once again, you must band together to fight as one...
At least, that was the idea![/quote]

Once again you don your reindeer horns to deliver dreams to the Servants of Chaldea.

title: halloween_comeback!
body:
[b]Ultra Demon Castle Csejte[br]Halloween Comeback! Super☆Ghouls 'n Pumpkins ~The Seeds of Adventure...~[/b]
[quote]Trick or Torture! I've missed you all, my pumpkins!

Once again, I will hold a special concert for all you pumpkins having a lonely Halloween...
Or I'd like to, but I'm in a bit of a pickle!

That's right! My beautiful Castle Csejte has been taken over by some weird witch! DIE!
Not only that, but she says Halloween is forbidden!
The whole castle is in a panic! My special concert is ruined!
You'll come to my aid in this time of peril, won't you, my pumpkins?![/quote]

Just when you thought you'd survived island life, a strange new land awaits your group - a true survival world.

title: mutsumi/mortis_headspace
body:
Shared headspace (mental world) occupied by [[Wakaba Mutsumi]] and her "dissociative alternate identity":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dissociative_identity_disorder [[Mortis (persona) (bang dream!)|Mortis]] in [[BanG Dream! It's MyGO!!!!!|BanG Dream! Ave Mujica]].

This space is usually depicted with the motifs/settings of a room with a wall of [[CRT]] [[television]] screens which show memories shared between the two and/or a theater whose audience is filled with [[clone]]s of Mutsumi or Mortis, as well as the presence of their [[Wakaba Mutsumi (doll)|doll]] personas.

h4. See also
* [[Wakaba Mutsumi (doll)]]
* [[Mortis (persona) (bang dream!)|]]

title: kenkou_ni_yoku_nai!_(bang_dream!)
body:
Scene from episode 4 of [[BanG Dream! It's MyGO!!!!!|BanG Dream! Ave Mujica]], [[Mortis (persona) (Bang Dream!)|Mortis]] says the line, 「健康によくない！」("[i]Kenkou ni yoku nai![/i]", translated as "It's not good for her health!") about [[Togawa Sakiko]]'s sleeping habits to [[Misumi Uika]] while making an [[x fingers]] gesture. This gesture appears similar to one made by [[Nagasaki Soyo]] during episode 3 of [[BanG Dream! It's MyGO!!!!!]].

h4. Reference
* !asset #24707819: Ave Mujica[br]Episode 4, 5:22
* !asset #24708896: It's MyGO!!!!![br]Episode 3, 14:09

h4. See also

title: xaihi_(arknights)
body:
A playable operator in [[arknights:_endfield|Arknights: Endfield]].

[quote]
Few people could immediately identify Xaihi's origins upon their first meeting with her. But the girl's occasional display of "Lateran vibes" would quickly reveal her affiliation with the Cabal of Tranquility.

Xaihi possesses a vast and seemingly trivial knowledge of many fields, especially those pertaining to information technology. During talks, she tends to jump from one strange topic to the next—a habit that one must get used to if they wish to converse with her. Xaihi herself, however, is utterly unaware of these issues.
[/quote]

title: tiny_wario
body:
A depowered form of [[Wario]]. 

In [i][[Wario Land: Super Mario Land 3]][/i] & [i][[Virtual Boy Wario Land]][/i], Wario becomes this when damaged by an enemy and can no longer do his usual attacks like the Shoulder Bash. In [i][[Wario Land II]][/i] it's one of his many transformations, inflicted by a [[Wizard (wario)|]]. Despite losing many of his attacks, it allows him to jump higher and squeeze through small crevices. In [i][[WarioWare]]: Smooth Moves[/i], Wario is accidentally separated into a plethora of multiple Tiny Warios by a motorcycle given by [[Penny Crygor]].

As the name suggests Tiny Wario is smaller in stature compared to regular Wario, often lacks his usual grin and doesn't wear a hat, revealing his [[bald]] head or a [[mohawk]]. In the WarioWare series instead of the shirt and overalls he wears a yellow [[singlet]] with [[yellow gloves]] and [[blue footwear|blue shoes]].

h4. Appearance
* !asset #25515113: Wario Land series
* !asset #25515114: WarioWare series

title: lightsaber
body:
[quote][i]“This is the weapon of a Jedi Knight. Not as clumsy or random as a blaster; an elegant weapon for a more civilized age...”[/i] ― [[Obi-Wan Kenobi]][/quote]

An [[energy sword]] from the [[Star Wars]] science fiction and [[fantasy]] universe, most often wielded by the honorable [[Jedi]] knights and their mortal enemies, the evil [[Sith]]. The sword's color typically reflects the user's affiliation, with the Jedi using green or blue, the Sith and other [[darksider (star wars)|darksiders]] using red, and miscellaneous other colors used by both factions.

title: fukashin_ryouiki_(neco)
body:
A series of illustrations by [[neco]] depicting girls with fantasy clothing and mostly melee weapons. The name "不花侵領域" is a pun on "不可侵領域" (inviolable territory), replacing the second character with "花" (flower). The characters all have flower-related names.

title: jerid_messa
body:
A fictional antagonist character from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. He appears in [[Zeta Gundam]]. 
Voiced by [[Inoue Kazuhiko]].

[b]Jerid Messa[/b] is an arrogant, brash member of the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] who unintentionally sparks a planetary conflict by insulting a [[kamille bidan|random guy]]. He has [[blonde hair]] and a [[pompadour]].

His mecha of choice are the [[Gundam Mk II]], the [[Hizack]], the [[Galbaldy Beta]] the [[Marasai]], the [[Gabthley]]. the [[Byalant]] and the [[Baund Doc]]. [spoilers]Dies at the end of The Gryps War in battle against Kamille Bidan's [[zeta_gundam_(mobile_Suit)|Zeta Gundam]] who threw his Baund Doc towards the wreckage of the recently destroyed [i][[henken_bekkener|Radish]][/i] [[AEUG]] [[military]] [[spacecraft]].[/spoilers]

title: magazine_(weapon)
body:
A device used for storing [[ammunition]] and feeding it into a repeating [[gun|firearm]]. May be referred to as a "mag" for short. Found in internal as well as external types, the most common is the detachable box magazine, such as that used by most modern [[assault_rifle|assault rifles]] and semi-automatic [[handgun]]s. Magazines generally have [[spring (object)|spring]]-like object inside that pushes ammunition into the chamber.

Not to be confused with a [[clip_(weapon)|]], a simple strip that store multiple rounds together as a unit for [[reloading]] into the fixed magazine or cylinder of a firearm.

h4. See also

* [[ammunition belt]]
* [[ammunition pouch]]
* [[bandolier]]

* [[drum magazine]]

title: amane_konata
body:
[[Amane Kanata]]'s "younger sister", first appearing on Kanata's 2025 [[April Fools]] stream.

Her appearance is very similar to Kanata, with both of them having [[grey hair]], [[purple eyes]], a shuriken/[[star halo|star-shaped halo]] and [[mini wings|small]]  [[feathered wings|feathered]] [[angel wings]]. The main differences are that Konata has [[black hair|black]] [[streaked hair]], her [[colored inner hair]] is [[purple hair|purple]] instead of blue, her halo is [[black halo|black]] and her wings [[gradient wings|gradient]] goes from [[white wings|white]] to [[black wings|black]], not to mention being much more [[large breasts|well endowed]] than her sister.

Her default costume is a [[black sweater|black]] [[turtleneck sweater|turtleneck]] [[aran sweater|aran]] [[virgin killer sweater]] with [[cleavage cutout|cleavage]] and [[shoulder cutout]]s (although it's sometimes depicted as a [[sleeveless turtleneck]] with [[detached sleeves]]), [[black thighhighs]] and [[black shoes]].

Her hairstyle is based on Kanata's hairstyle from her [[amane kanata (work)|Work costume]], being [[long hair]] in a [[two side up]] held with [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon]]s witha [[single hair intake]] and long [[asymmetrical bangs]] [[hair over one eye|covering her right eye]].

h4. Appearance

h4. See also

title: lu_lingqi
body:
Refers to Koei's portrayal of [[Lu Bu]]'s daughter.

She is portrayed as a young woman who shares his father's love for battle. In Shin Sangoku Musou 7: Moushouden/Dynasty Warriors 8: Xtreme Legends, she is never portrayed together with Diaochan as she appears only in Lu Bu's forces' historical route and the latter in the early parts and the hypothetical route.
